questions.question_text: Which command on ESXi Is used to verify the Local Control Plane connectivity with Central Control Plane?

choices.A: esxcli network ip connection list | grep ccpd
choices.C: esxcli network ip connection list | grep netcpa
choices.B: esxcli network ip connection list | grep 1234
choices.D: esxcli network ip connection list | grep 1235

discussion.content: D is correct 1235 is used for ccp and 1234 is used for nsx manager
esxcli network ip connection list | grep 1234

choices.C: deploy NSX Edge on a bare-metal server
choices.B: deploy NSX Edge VM with ISO image
choices.A: deploy NSX Edge VM with QCOW2 image
choices.D: deploy NSX Edge VM with OVF template

questions.question_text: Which is correct when deploying a NSX Edge in a KVM only environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
CD or actually IPsec and L2 VPN

Answer should be C,D

https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/2.4/administration/GUID-3E992AD4-F911-468F-999F-B20A37EFCCBD.html

NSX-T Data Center provides system-generated IKE profiles that are assigned by default when you configure an IPSec VPN or L2 VPN service. The following table lists the default profiles provided:

nsx-default-l2vpn-ike-profile
Used for an L2 VPN service configuration.
Configured with IKE V2, AES 128 encryption algorithm, SHA2 256 algorithm, and Diffie-Hellman group14 key exchange algorithm.

nsx-default-l3vpn-ike-profile
Used for an IPSec VPN service configuration.
Configured with IKE V2, AES 128 encryption algorithm, SHA2 256 algorithm, and Diffie-Hellman group 14 key exchange algorithm.

D & E is correct. I checked on actual NSX-T, it has option for 

1) ipsec
2) L2VPN
3) SSL VPN+ 

Since no ipsec vpn is given, D & E are correct. 

L3VPN is called MPLS L3VPN. To confuse, they gave option B & C splitted.

answer : L2VPN, L3VPN(IPSec base L3VPN)
NSX is Support SSL + ( not nsx-t)
https://www.ipspace.net/VMware_NSX_Technical_Deep_Dive

NSX-T Data Center supports IPSec Virtual Private Network (IPSec VPN) and Layer 2 VPN (L2 VPN) on an NSX Edge node. This is NSX-T not NSX-V...so the correct answer "IPSEC" is not in the list. https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-T-Data-Center/2.4/administration/GUID-A8B113EC-3D53-41A5-919E-78F1A3705F58.html

D & E is correct. per the documentation: 
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX-Data-Center-for-vSphere/6.4/com.vmware.nsx.admin.doc/GUID-FB4BEB23-6A87-4291-A90B-826F69C1F7B6.html

Answer C/(L3VPN) is not listed as a supported VPN type.
